patterns: I have a short temper. How do I take care of my short temper?

responses:
Anger is one of the things that easily causes interpersonal relationship and social issues. But it's not something you can't overcome.
Start off by thinking before you speak. In the heat of the moment, it's easy to say something you'll later regret. Take a few moments to collect your thoughts before saying anything.

Short-temper effects many of the youth in the current age and it can leave long-lasting scars. But it's not uncurable. Here are some ways you can take control of your anger:
	1) Give yourself short breaks during times of the day that tend to be stressful.
	2)Physical activity can help reduce stress that can cause you to become angry.
	3)State your concerns and needs clearly and directly, without hurting others or trying to control them.
